title: AHOYBRAUSE
author: AHOYBRAUSE
content: Not a real accusation but more of a warning for stake.com players.Recently fake post monthly bonus notifications have been sent out so please double check if you have the right telegram channel for it.Pre- and post monthly bonus notifications always come via email and never on telegram.So please do not click on any links from fake channels on tg.Here is what was sent out today:

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Asa rule admins of any legit channel will not message you, and they always give strong warnings for impostors and people impersonating their admins so the basic rule should be to block this user, check the setting of your account so you will not receive spam emails like this.Based on the screenshot you posted, he urges you to open your email but on the same message, he also urges you to click a link, this is to deceive users that they are legit so never click links coming from unknown people.

comments.author: sujonali1819
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on January 30, 2023, 02:53:52 PMBased on the screenshot you posted, he urges you to open your email but on the same message, he also urges you to click a link, this is to deceive users that they are legit so never click links coming from unknown people.This is the trick the scammer has used to make him legit. So that some fool (yes they are really fools) people believe the man is really from the stake and click on the link instead of opening the email. Btw anyone from telegram like this can not be a legit person. So always avoid him and block them instantly.

comments.author: AnonBitCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on January 30, 2023, 02:23:56 PMNot a real accusation but more of a warning for stake.com players.Recently fake post monthly bonus notifications have been sent out so please double check if you have the right telegram channel for it.Pre- and post monthly bonus notifications always come via email and never on telegram.So please do not click on any links from fake channels on tg.Here is what was sent out today:Blue Tick mark is so dangerous and lazy people can be Easily decieved. Telegram should take action in these fake and scam channels and account and should be permanently banned otherwise most of users will be fall victim of these scammers. Hacker's are very clever and they trying to use every way to get access of other funds and this kind of scamming is part of it We should forget this phrase "" Admin will never DM First"" . If any admin which looking 100% legit dm you first then it's 100% scam. Similarly those channel who add you without joining are scams and should be report spam instantly.

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Yes obviously I didn't fall for this. I am with stake for many years and know how they send pre- and post monthlies.Also I am subscribed to the real telegram channels from stake, thats why on top it asks me if I want to "add the user".Just wanted to show this as a warning as some players might fall for it.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on January 30, 2023, 04:00:57 PMYes obviously I didn't fall for this. I am with stake for many years and know how they send pre- and post monthlies.Also I am subscribed to the real telegram channels from stake, thats why on top it asks me if I want to "add the user".Just wanted to show this as a warning as some players might fall for it.Thank you for sharing this warning. The person who messaged you is a scammer who purchased the Telegram Premium service and paid $3.99 per month and got one of the premium features, which is a badge next to his name, which is an emoji of the verification mark. You find these scammers in abundance in all crypto groups, not only in the stake group, They send messages to investors and beginners in order to deceive them and steal their funds through a fake link or something like that, so we have to be careful and whoever sends messages to you first, block him because admins never send messages to people first, this is a rule followed to prevent fraud.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: AHOYBRAUSE on January 30, 2023, 04:00:57 PMJust wanted to show this as a warning as some players might fall for it.You did a good job. Because this tempting offer will attract new gamblers and they may fall prey to such scams. This warning will make them more alert. Clicking on any unknown link is always risky, so gamblers should refrain from clicking any link from any unknown source. Scammers are now using different techniques to scam, now they are starting to use the stake.com name. Scammers will continue to use this technique in the coming days.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: albon on January 30, 2023, 06:08:47 PM-snip-The person who messaged you is a scammer who purchased the Telegram Premium service and paid $3.99 per month and got one of the premium features,It be sad if telegram gave a blue badge that shouldn't be available even for super premium users. They indirectly open opportunities for people to get scammed. The $4 subscription price is too affordable even for novice scammers.I think this thread deserves a move to the B&H board with a more general title, since the point of the topic is a warning about a company's fake telegram account with a verification emoji. There is a possibility that similar accounts with other company names will emerge.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Oh Wow. Telegram is already known as a scammer's paradise. Because it's easy to handle Telegram and delete them as long as they are done. I am surprised that Scammers are started to buy Telegram Premium to make it look like they are real. Whatever, I don't know if stakes give you support Via Telegram because I am not a VIP there. But, I believe such casinos always send promos and other offers via email. Scammers send emails too. So, You have to be careful before you click on any link.
